item.title: Personal// Valentines
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
If you know me, you know Ilive and breath my culture and industry. Weddings and beauty, who wouldn't? A large part of my job is social. I have to update facebook, instagram, twitter, pinterest and g+. I build relationships with other vendors, brides and artists. Networking and socializing has been built into my regular routine. My morning routine includes a cup of coffee and instagram; I'll twitter while I'm on the elliptical and I pin while I eat lunch. As unhealthy as some may view it, I enjoy it. On valentines day this is especially harrowing.I scroll through photograph after photograph of happy, beautiful couples. Bouquets of roses, hand made cards, boxes of chocolates and romantic gestures. When I scroll, I scroll with envy.

 

 

 

I am happily married to an amazing man, why would this bother me? I realized the answer to this today while I was scrolling through facebook. We don't build up holidays like valentines day. We spent our first wedding anniversary watching re-runs of the office while eating Red Lobster take out on our couch. We don't hand make cards or leave hunt clues for the other to wake up to. We don't purchase large hearts of chocolate and I don't get flowers delivered. Through all of this slight envy of friends posting sweet photos of romantic things their significant others have done for them I realized something.

 

We love differently. If I hadn't been paying attention, I would have missed it.

 

I am a very social person, obviously. However, Jd is not. He is my exact opposite. Where I am loud, he is quiet. Where I prefer large groups and new people; he pretty much hates them. A large portion of my job [can you call it a job if you love it?] is networking. I spend a few nights a month at a beautiful venue, drinking specialty cocktails, meeting new wedding vendors and gabbing with the ones I already know. Never in the history of my business has my husband see the inside of one of these events. Each time, I ask; almost expecting his answer. "No thanks, I'd rather lose an eye."

 

 

[caption id="attachment_2433" align="aligncenter" width="533"] Photo Credit: Christine Barker Photography[/caption]

 

This year I was invited to a beautiful event called sparkle lounge at theRonald Reagan Building. It is quite an event, over the top with a large and important guest list. With the weather, it was postponed for tonight. Valentines night. The night where most people are making dinner together, exchanging fluffy gifts and I don't know, reading poetry to each other? While I wont be receiving any of those things, I am getting a beautiful gift. If I hadn't been paying attention I would have missed it. I would have missed my husbands love and his own romantic gesture.

 

When I asked him if he would like to go, he hesitated for a second and said yes. I was shocked. Never in 4 years. After thinking about it for a bit I realized I am getting a beautiful gift. My introvert, quiet husband is giving me something that is more important than roses and chocolate. He is stepping outside of his comfort zone. He is doing something he dreads and something that makes him uncomfortable for me. He is giving me, the social butterfly the most beautiful gift. I get to walk into this amazing event with my handsome husband. I get to spend the evening introducing him to my co-workers, enjoying a glass of wine, dinner and dancing. Most of all I get to lay my head down tonight, scrolling through instagram and I get to know that my husband gave me a sweet gift, more important than champagne and roses.

 

Happy Valentines

xo

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Happy Valentine's Day! I'm so happy you realized the beauty of your unique love <3 <3
What a beautiful article you wrote! Happy Valentine's Day and enjoy your evening!

item.title: Personal// Dear John
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Dear Jd,

I was asked by someone important in our lives a pretty profound question, "What are you most proud of?" I had to think for a second. At first glance, one might think that my business would be my proudest accomplishment. I am sure that is what you think as well. While I am happy and humbled by this thing I have built, it isn't it. The one thing in my life I am most proud of is our marriage. This beautiful thing that we have given ourselves to. We've committed to building this for the two of us. We stood up and committed to each other that we would see this life through together.

I have only ever seen one successful marriage, my grandparents. Even that was at a bit of a distance. I don't know how to do this, I was never taught or given an example. I am navigating this new terrain with you holding my hand and helping me when I stumble.This has been one hell of a year; filled with pitfalls, unpaved paths and struggle. It has had some serious highs and so valley level, lows. Even then, when we get to a break in the path I can turn and smile at you. I am proud of this marriage, proud of what we have built. I am most proud of our strength. Thank you for walking this path with me, for committing to me and for giving me all of your love.

Happy 2nd year anniversary. Love you.

xo

 

I also want to wish my dear friend and wedding twins Amanda & Jack a happy 7 years! <3

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Happy anniversary, wedding day twin. I admire you guys so much. You two were made for each other, and together you stand tall. Together you can make it through anything.

item.title: Real Wedding// Mamata & Kumar
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Mamata and Kumar were married on a beautiful, sunny afternoon last fall. When we arrived bright and early to get her ready for her ceremony there was an electric buzz floating around her hotel room. The same kind of excitement we see most Saturday mornings, yet a little more. South Asian weddings are stunning, classic and a little more intense than traditional American weddings. Perhaps that played a part in her morning, maybe but maybe not. It could also have been that she was ready, completely and totally to marry Kumar. To walk into that stunning ceremony space and commit her forever to him. Read on to see one gorgeous bride, abeautifulbackdrop and atangibleamount of love.

xo

Thank you to the talented team at Photographick Studios for sharing these images!

Hair and Makeup

Abby

item.title: Personal// tick tock
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[caption id="attachment_2539" align="aligncenter" width="500"] Photo Credit organissimo.org[/caption]

 

I think I missed the bus. I am standing on the chilly side walk, clutching my purse and staring at my phone. Watching the minutes trickle by. I am going to be late. Tapping my foot impatiently and sighing quietly while I wait. Little did I know, the bus had already passed. Another 7, 8 minutes slide by and then it dawns on me. I missed it. If I hadn't gone back in to grab that book I left on the night stand I would have made it on time. If I hadn't taken the extra few minutes fussing with my eye liner I wouldn't be late. Growing in my frustration I pull up the bus schedule. I am going to be late. I am going to miss things, disappoint someone and I am frazzled. Waiting for the schedule to load I just want to scream. I thought I was on top of everything, I thought I had enough time to get here and now. Now I am late. Finally the schedule loads, I skim the screen quickly and realize the next bus will be here in 3 minutes. I may be late, but I think I could still make it. In fact, I'm early. I'm early for the second bus. Relief.

 

Okay, so I don't really ride the bus. The closest thing I've ridden when it comes to a public bus is the DC subway. Which I don't think is the same. Either way, this analogy is how I feel about 2014. I feel like I missed the bus full of goal setting, ideas and plans. New promises and new projects. I spent the last week kicking myself; I missed the new year strectch. The time when everyone lays out their to 'dos' and 'things to achieve' list. I thought that the bus had already come. Until I realized that another bus will be around in minutes. It is never too late in the year for me to set my 2014 goals. It is never to late to begin again. It isn't for you either.If you feel like you've missed that bus too, here is my public support. It is never too late to start a new. Join me on that second bus, there is still time. Happy New Years dear friend.

 

xo,

Alison

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I feel like I missed the New Years stretch too! HOW THE HELL is it March already?! My wedding season starts in like ten days!
It's never too late to plan and dream... And New Years is such an arbitrary date. You can start 'new' at any point! This year is going to be AMAZING for you... I can already feel it!

item.title: Published// Washingtonian Bride & Groom Magazine
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
There are certain goals that come easily and then there are those that you get by pushing through to the finish line. This my friends, is the later. Last year I set a list of goals. At the very bottom it read "Find one AH&CO bride in Washingtonian Bride & Groom." On New Years Eve, I sat down with my list and proudly scratched each item, except one. That last one, the illusive Washingtonian. For a second I sat, proud anyway of our achievements and finally accepted that we had reached 99% of my planned goals. I was content, the other 19 we're met; I can live with missing just 1 goal.

 

A few hours later, I was in the grocery picking up a few items for a friends party that night when I turned down the magazine aisle. Glancing across the magazine rack, I picked up a copy of the 2014 Washingtonian and sifted through it. The universe has a tricky way of giving you exactly what you need. Not more, not less; but exactly what you need. I flipped a page to find not just one of our stunning brides, but two. Susie and Kristi we're a sweet couple. They were married at the Long View Gallery last season in one of the most beautiful and intimate weddings I have seen.My team and I are honored to have worked with Susie & Kristi, and excited to see their gorgeous wedding featured in the Washingtonian. Thank you both for allowing us to celebrate with you. I sincerelyhope that you felt as beautiful as you looked that day!

 

Hair & Makeup

Stephanie

Jesseca

Thank you Rodney Bailey Photography for capturing everything so beautifully!

Please excuse the terrible scan job. It barely does the wedding justice.

Talented Vendor Team:

// Photographer: Rodney Bailey Photography // Flowers & Event Decor: Studio DBI // Music: E2 Events //

// Caterer: Spilled Milk Catering // Transportation: Chariots for hire //

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I absolutely love this wedding! Congratulations on the feature!
How incredible! CONGRATS!!! Oh, the humor of the universe!
Beautiful wedding, beautiful feature! The scan job may not be ideal, but you can still tell it was stunning :)
What an awesome feature! Congrats!
They look stunning- congrats on having it in print, so awesome!
What an honor! It's a great feeling to get work published!!
Congrats on getting published! Awesome!

item.title: Ask the Artist// How to get healthy, color treated hair
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Hi Alison!

I know that your team specializes in styling hair, but I am hoping that you could help me with a problem with my hair. I have shoulder length hair, fine hair that I get colored pretty regularly. It always seems not to be as smooth and strong as I'd like it. I am having trouble growing my hair out because it is so fragile. Do you have any products or suggestions to help my hair to feel a little healthier?

Sincerely,

Healthy Hair Dreams.

Oh that is such a common challenge!You would be surprised, dear 'Healthy Hair Dreams'.Keeping healthy, colored hair is quite a challenge.Here are a few suggestions from my talented team of artists.

Kaitlyn

 

My ALL TIME favorite is Pureology. The hydrating shampoo and conditioner is the best. The whole line is color safe but that's my favorite one. It's sulfate free and also 100% vegan. It's really good for blondes too, because it puts moisture back in. The conditioner has a "tingling" feeling (which feels great on your scalp) this line can be a little pricey compared to others but is well worth it. They also have treatments that you can get done in the salon.

 

 

Kelsea

 

There are few things I love to talk about as much as I love to talk about my favorite shampoo & conditioner! I went through a really hard time with the health of my hair after it being color treated. I really wanted to grow my hair out but felt my hairwas always dry until I started to use Neuma Moisture shampoo & conditioner. This line of shampoo & conditioner is top of the line and is not like any other shampoo and conditioner I have ever used. The product is infused with essential oils to penetrate into the hair in order to rebuild keratin protein lost during color treatments. As the shampoo and conditioner hydrates the cuticle, the hair becomes more manageable leaving your hair feeling soft and silky. I have very thick hair, in the most obnoxious way possible and this shampoo and conditioner totally transforms the texture of my hair every time!

 

 

Anne-Marie

 

Arrojo Color Save is my favorite. It preserves color, gives shine, has vitamin B5 and oat proteins to strengthen the hair and is good for all colored hair types. For those with curly, color treated hair, Deva Curl is an excellent choice. Deva Curl adds moisture, but is very lightweight. It is also important for everyone to know that professional products should only be purchased in a licensed salon. If you buy a professional brand at the drugstore, that is diverted product and is most likely either expired or something other than what it is claimed to be.

item.title: Personal// Love of the Irish
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Nl leigheas ar an ngr ach psadh.

(There is no cure for love, but marriage.)

My grandfather was a bull headed, Irish man who loved my strong willed grandmother. I always think of them on this holiday. They loved this holiday and they loved each other. I want to wish you a very, beautiful St. Patrick's day full of things other than just spirits. The Irish are a country with loyalty, luck and love. Happy day of love from a culture based heavily in it.

xo,

AH

___________________________________________

May the road rise to meet you,
May the wind be always at your back.
May the sun shine warm upon your face,
The rains fall soft upon your fields.
And until we meet again,
May God hold you in the palm of his hand.



May God be with you and bless you;
May you see your children's children.
May you be poor in misfortune,
Rich in blessings,
May you know nothing but happiness
From this day forward.


May the road rise to meet you
May the wind be always at your back
May the warm rays of sun fall upon your home
And may the hand of a friend always be near.


May green be the grass you walk on,
May blue be the skies above you,
May pure be the joys that surround you,
May true be the hearts that love you.

 

-Irish Blessing

 

 [caption id="attachment_2598" align="aligncenter" width="214"] Photo Credit: Joelle Lee photography[/caption]

 

[caption id="attachment_2599" align="aligncenter" width="300"] Photo Credit: Joelle Lee Photography[/caption]

___________________________________________

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I love Irish blessings! So sweet!
love this! happy st. pattys day :)
<3 LOVE THIS. <3 Bookmarking!
perfect! Happy St. Patrick's Day!
So sweet, I hope you had a great St. Patrick's Day!

item.title: Announcement// Extreme Lashes & Waxing
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
The good news: I am excited to announce that we will now be offeringXtreme Lashes Eyelash Extensions and waxing, all on location.

The bad news: These services are only available in the Washington, DC Metro area at the moment.

Either way, I am beyond excited to finally offer both waxing and lash extensions. In our normal fashion, everything is on location. I will tell you, I never add a service or an artist with out first trying the services myself first. These lashes were no exception. I mean, no one had to twist my arm, but I needed to see how these lashes lasted and felt. I had our Xtreme Lash certified artist Maeghen apply them to me and I haven't had to wear mascara at all this week. It has been amazing! Honestly, I'm converted. I'll pretty much wear these until I die. So, let me explain a little about these lash extensions.

They are individually placed, demi-permanent lashes; each eye lash is placed on a singular natural lash. These lashes are safe, natural looking and last up to 3-4 weeks. They are the perfect service leading up to your wedding. Get them done 3 days before the wedding and you have lashes for your rehearsal dinner, wedding day and the honeymoon. We'll even come take them off for your or fill them in.

_____________________________________________________________________________

To help explain a little more about these new services, I've written a little Q and A. Hopefully this will help explain a little more:

Can you explain how the waxing services work?

Absolutely! We have an entire set up, we come to you for all services. We have everything we need, all we need is a little space. We offer three different package; Upper, lower and Brazilian. The Upper package includes all facial waxing, underarms and arms. The Lower package includes legs and bikini and the Brazilian includes either full or partial Brazilian.

What if I don't want a my arms waxed?

Not to worry, we offer all of these items in the packages but you can pick and choose which you would like to receive. If you are only interested in facial waxing, you can opt out of the additional offers.

Can you explain the Xtreme lash service to me?

Xtreme Lashes Semi-Permanent Eyelash Extensions are natural-looking, synthetic eyelashes applied one by one to each individual natural lash. These lashes were developed to mimic your natural lashes; its design features a tapered tip with a thicker base to resemble the look and feel of a natural lash. The luxurious natural look of Xtreme Lashes Eyelash Extensions is achieved by a meticulous and artful application of synthetic lashes, all applied one by one to your natural lash by a certified Xtreme Lashes Lash Stylist.

You can expect your initial eyelash extension procedure to be scheduled for up to 3 hours. This time allows you to rest and be pampered as we transforms your lashes to the customized lash look you have selected. With Xtreme Lashes' diverse inventory of over 600 individual styles of eyelash extensions, we can design a tailored look that is full and natural.

How do I remove Xtreme lashes?

If you would like them removed after your honeymoon we would love to help. We will come and remove them for you, it is included in our service cost so there is no additional fee. We do not recommend attempting to remove them yourself.

How long do the Xtreme lashes last?

This can depend on a few factors that include how you care for them, if you tend to get quite oily and what products you use with them. With proper care and maintenance, touch ups are typically only needed once every 2 to 4 weeks to replace the lashes that have shed.

Natural eyelashes grow in and fall out in cycles (every 60 to 90 days). When a natural lash matures and falls out, a new lash has already been growing and quickly replaces it without us noticing the turnover. This process is constant and at any given moment our many natural lashes are at different stages of maturity. Some are just growing in, while others are ready to shed. People typically shed between 1 and 5 natural lashes each day, depending on their individual growth cycles. On shorter natural lashes, this growing and shedding cycle is virtually unnoticeable.

Can the Xtreme Lashes harm my natural eye lashes?

Xtreme Lashes cause no damage to the natural lashes. The adhesives have been developed to exacting specifications. The top priority of Xtreme Lashes was to ensure a thoroughly safe product so they have chosen to follow the standards set by the US Medical Industry and top US Surgeons. The main ingredient in both adhesives is the same ingredient used for suture-less wound closure. These adhesives are the perfect blend of safety, longevity, flexibility and strength.

Can I receive Xtreme Lashes prior to or after my wedding services?

Absolutely! If you would prefer to give them a try before wearing them on the wedding day or if you would like to maintain them after, we would love to set that appointment up for you. Please feel free to email us atInfo@alisonharperandcompany.comto get that arranged.
